Inadequate infrastructure and facilities for collecting and processing recyclable materials.
Resistance from businesses and residents who may not see the value in recycling or may be unwilling to invest time and resources in implementing it.
Inefficient or outdated recycling systems that may not effectively sort and process materials.
Inadequate funding for the initiative, which may limit the scope and effectiveness of the program.
Difficulty in coordinating and collaborating with various stakeholders, including government agencies, community groups, and private organizations.
